page.title: 06A newcomer to Sandwich.
page.content: We moved to Sandwich in August 1984. It seemed like an interesting town with many characteristics. The first thing that we bought here was a sixteen foot cruising boat. We had always wanted a boat, and living near the River Stour meant that we had the chance to have one. We had moved into the R.A.F. married quarters near the industrial estate, and thought that this would mean that we would not have much traffic. We soon found this was not so and lorries drove past at all hours. It did have its good points though, it was near to Stonar Lake. If we join the Sandwich Sailing and Motor Boat Club then we can take our dinghy out on the lake and go to parties in the clubhouse. Also living near to the mooring means we don't have to go all the way across town to get to it. Our house is alright for our needs.
